answers.answer: They check different thing in urine to determine if you have any infection or protein in your urine ....not very helpful but that's all I know about it x
Mostly for protein in your urine they compare your levels to see f you are developing preeclampsia

They check the sugars, he did a test with mine and I've never had high glucose in my life. And the colour it came up, he said I have keytone colours in my urine indicating higher glucose levels. So he sent me for a bloodtest . It's common for pregnant women to get diabetes during pregnancy then it go away once the baby is born .
They also use it to test for urinary tract infections and subsequently culturing the bacteria to figure out what antibiotic to prescribe.

question: Hey ladies. Was curious if anyone knew why exactly the doctors ask you to pee for every doctor visit? They already know im pregnant, so its not a pregnancy test. What exactly do they test the urine for though?
title: Pee test during dr visits
